Detailed Description

The GQR library computes Gaussian and Gaussian-type quadrature rules including some which handle singular integrands. A simple example of its use to integrate a function is: example.c.

The functions described here are used to generate the quadrature rules and do basic operations such as reading them from and writing them to a file.

Typedef Documentation

gqr_func

A type for evaluating integrands and their derivatives.

Parameters:
t evaluation point;
i the order of derivative to be evaluated;
data user data to be passed to the function.
Returns:
value of the th derivative of the function at .
gqr_parameter_t

A data structure containing parameters for quadrature rules which require them.

gqr_rule_t

Data structure containing the nodes and weights of a quadrature rule. The rule is allocated using gqr_rule_alloc and initialized using gqr_rule_select. To transform the range of integration use gqr_rule_scale.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum gqr_t

A type defining the quadrature rules available. A quadrature rule is defined as a basic type possibly combined with a singularity. For example GQR_GAUSS_LEGENDRE | GQR_GAUSS_HYPERSINGULAR specifies a Gauss-Legendre rule which handles singularities up to and including second order. Note that not all of these rules are implemented yet. GQR will return an error message if you try to use an unimplemented rule.

gqr_t gqr_rule_from_name ( gchar *  str,
gqr_parameter_t *  p 
)

Parse a string description of a GQR rule, returning a gqr_t description, intended for use in parsing command line options.

Parameters:
str a string containing a description of a GQR rule, e.g. "GQR_GAUSS_LEGENDRE | GQR_GAUSS_LOGARITHMIC";
p NULL or a gqr_parameter_t which will be filled with the data relevant to the selected rule type.
Returns:
a gqr_t description of the rule in str, or an error code.

Generate a string giving the name of the quadrature rule (Legendre, Hermite, etc.) and any singularities built into it.

Parameters:

Returns:
a string giving the name of rule type.
